element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithms creates a raster layer from a points layer, using the Inverse Distance Weighting inteprolation method.
In this method, the value for a given coordinate is calculated as a weighted sum of all the points within a search area defined by a search radius. The weight assigned to each point depends on the distance from that point to the coordinate where the value is to be calculated, according to the following formula.

element.name: FIELD
element.text: The field in the input layer that contains the variable to be interpolated

element.name: DIST
element.text: The search radius in map units. Only points within that area defined by this radius are used.

element.name: POWER
element.text: The k value in the above formula. A value of 2 is commonly used.

element.name: RESULT
element.text: The resulting layer with interpolated values. No-data values are assigned to cells with no input points within the defined search radius.

element.name: CROSSVALIDATION
element.text: Cross validation table. This is calculated interpolating at the corrdinates of the input points, using all the points except the one at that coordinate. Expected values and values obtained from interpolation are then compared to evaluate the correctness of the model, which is summarized in this table.
